title: Hand writing font
content:
Hi all

I’m looking for a really nice handwriting font - any suggestions?

I saw a copy of Arena in the UK with Beyonce on the cover that was good, and going back a few months Wired used a nice one on the cover.

It’s to be used alongside Helvetica Neue for names of interviewees in a sports magazine.

Any help very much appreciated as always.

 [‹ A Good FREE Novel Font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080215235304/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27455 "Go to previous forum topic") [Between humanist and gothic/grotesk ? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080215235304/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27523 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dendicott

comments.content: [Dear Sarah Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080215235304/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000104) is a beautiful handwriting face. Not sure about using it in a sports magazine, though. What sort of feel are you thinking of?
Perhaps the magazine should get the interviewees to hand-write their own names for each interview.

[http://www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/joebob/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080215235304/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/joebob/ "http://www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/joebob/")

Some lively handwriting fonts, not match for a bit of hand-lettering and scanning, though.  
Tim
